content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey guys the crafton DM here DM Scotty and
welcome to my channel today I'm going to do a project that is for the 10
accessory for the table not necessarily for to put in the actual game itself but
what I'm going to do is I'm going to customize a dice tray so I'm going to
start out with this this here it's a it's a hexagonal dice tray it's just
made out of wood but what I'm going to do is I'm going to modify it I'm going
to make it look like a creature is emerging from this well like crawling
out of the well I'm going to do some sculpting to add some 3d elements to it
so it should be really neat I'll do some painting and painting on and inside of
it so let's go to the table and I'll show you how I started doing that
project talking about the dice tray hands as you can see here I have
sculpted the claws for my project the monsters gonna be emerging from the dice
look like the monsters emerging from the dice tray I've sculpted the claws out of
super sculpt Lee and it has that distinctive pink color so I'll bake
those up and then we'll be ready for the next part of the project you can see
here that I have a welt of tongue it's a forked tongue coming out from the dice
tray and it's wrapping around the bottom of the edge so it's the same material
the super sculpt Lee and I'll bake that up and we'll move on to the next step
here's the dice tray I'm going to use for my project it's it's a plain wood
tray so it'll be easy to paint and customize so what I'm gonna do is open
this up see what I got inside so that's the dice tray itself so it's just a
plain wood die straight but I've also a base painted my pieces that'll be on
here so what I'm going to do is I'll show you how that's going to
assemble I will attach the tongue like this and then when I paint inside I'll
have the tongue coming down and I will look like it's going out there then I'll
put the hands or the claws coming out like this so it'll look like it's
pulling itself out of the the dice trace that would be really nice so I'm paying
a face inside and then I'll do I'm going to do like a stone texture on the
outside so that should be really neat hey guys I've taken the bottom of my
dice tray off and the reason I did that was I decided that I'm going to add some
foam to this to make it so it's not so loud when you roll into it and so what I
did was I laid this on a piece of a black foam that you can get at the craft
store and I traced a pencil line through a pencil through these slots and then I
was able to cut it out and so here's the piece and it'll fit right on there so
I'm gonna glue this on there and I've got it well within the range that it
doesn't block the slot so I can put this back on without any kind of problem and
this stuff is pretty easy to paint on so it shouldn't be a problem as far as the
painting goes so all I want to show you that before I started the painting I had
changed my mind decided to add this foam to the project so go back and paint it
up and I'll show you how cool this ends up looking hey guys I decided to do one
more thing with this I took my flexible modeling paste and
apply it to the edge because I want to give it like a stone like texture and I
think that worked out really well and then I did some lines to differentiate
some of the block the stone blocks now if you're not familiar with the texture
it's I use this liquid Tex flexible modeling paste and it works great for
kind of applications like this and there you go so now we'll paint this up like
stone and then you'll see the creature look like that's emerging out of the the
dice roller so I'll be back and show you that
all right check out the dice tray I think it came out really cool so you can
see it looks like the monster is emerging from the from the pit here and
I give you a little closer look there so there's the monster I just painted on
the foam inside and then I have its tongue you can see its tongue extends
out and then it comes around the bottom I add some gloss to that to make it look
really slimy and then they got the claws grabbing out from each side so it really
looks like it's emerging and then the stone texture on the rest that really
gives it that look of some ancient well or pit and we put that down there for a
sec and Chuck some dice in here all right cool the new dice tray
also I did something on the back I added some foam to the bottom so that really
helps it from sliding around I just traced it out and then cut a piece of
the foam and put it on the bottom so that really keeps the piece from sliding
around so you can see it's just doesn't want to go wherever it was what it would
be it would push quite easily if I tapped it like that so there we go very
cool i dice tray that you can make and looking forward to using it in some
games you
